intro: Psychotria novohiberiensis, commonly known as the New Hiberian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded understory habitats within tropical rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem, though it remains relatively understudied.
